title: Ikechukwu Onyeka
text:
Ikechukwu Onyeka is a Nigerian director.
Early life and education.
Onyeka is from <a href="Umuoji">Umuoji</a>, <a href="Idemili%20North">Idemili North</a> local government in <a href="Anambra%20State">Anambra State</a>. In 2012, he enrolled to <a href="Colorado%20Film%20School">Colorado Film School</a> to study cinematography. He highlighted his quest to get optimal knowledge in film-making as his reason for taking a break to return to school.
Career.
Prior to film-making, Onyeka was an <a href="bike%20rider">okada</a> rider. Between 1998 and 2006, he directed 70 films and had produced thirteen. Onyeka ventured into Nollywood as a property manager, before becoming production manager, producer, assistant director then director. According to him, he didn't like acting because of the publicity that comes along with it. He has also founded his production company, Lykon pictures. Onyeka is described as one of the "most accomplished directors" in <a href="Nollywood">Nollywood</a>. In 2010, during an interview in <a href="New%20York%20City">New york</a>, he stated that having worked with most big names in the industry, <a href="Genevieve%20Nnaji">Genevieve Nnaji</a> is arguably the "only star in Nollywood", he cited her professionalism as reason for this. He explained that other actors were popular, but not stars. He also described <a href="Mercy%20Johnson">Mercy Johnson</a> as the most popular face in the film industry.
